educational_objective: Recognize Neisseria meningitidis in a cerebrospinal fluid specimen Gram stain.
question_text: A 19-year-old woman is evaluated for meningitis. She is a college student living in a dormitory.A cerebrospinal fluid specimen Gram stain is shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely causative agent?
critique: The most likely causative agent is Neisseria meningitidis (Option D). The image demonstrates gram-negative diplococci that have flattened opposing sides, which is characteristic of N. meningitidis. Where available, multiplex polymerase chain reaction assay is a preferred method for detecting N. meningitidis, Streptococcus pneumoniae, Haemophilus influenzae, and Listeria monocytogenes, because it has high sensitivity and specificity and allows more rapid diagnosis than does culture.

figures.title: Gram Stain of Cerebrospinal Fluid Showing Gram-Negative Diplococci
